docs.abstract: If Washington is serious about tackling the budget deficit and growing the U.S. economy, how would our tax system need to change?
docs.snippet: If Washington is serious about tackling the budget deficit and growing the U.S. economy, how would our tax system need to change?

headline.main: When Paying It Forward Pays Us Back

docs.abstract: Social programs are often the target of conservative budget cuts, but they often save us money. Investing in the best of them will save even more.
docs.snippet: Social programs are often the target of conservative budget cuts, but they often save us money. Investing in the best of them will save even more.

headline.main: Chipping Away at Poverty -- an Exchange

docs.abstract: A back-and-forth about SSI, my reporting and how best to make progress on poverty.
docs.snippet: A back-and-forth about SSI, my reporting and how best to make progress on poverty.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senate aides inserted a giveaway into the “fiscal cliff” bill that will benefit the drug maker, but will cost Medicare $500 million.

headline.seo: Amgen Gets a Gift From Congress
headline.main: Amgen Gets a Gift From Congress
headline.print_headline: Amgen Gets a Gift From Congress

docs.abstract: Editorial asserts provision inserted into fiscal bill approved by Congress benefits drug maker Amgen but will cost Medicare $500 million; says provision, which allows Amgen to evade Medicare cost-cutting controls by delaying prices restraints on drugs used by kidney dialysis patients, is classic example of power of special interests to shape legislation.
docs.snippet: Senate aides inserted a giveaway into the “fiscal cliff” bill that will benefit the drug maker, but will cost Medicare $500 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of low-income people could be required to pay more for health care under a proposed federal policy that would give states more freedom to impose additional charges on Medicaid patients.

headline.seo: Medicaid Patients Could Face Higher Fees Under a Proposed Federal Policy
headline.main: Many Medicaid Patients Could Face Higher Fees Under a Proposed Federal Policy
headline.print_headline: Many Medicaid Patients Could Face Higher Fees Under a Proposed Federal Policy

docs.abstract: Millions of low-income people could be required to pay more for health care under a policy proposed by the Obama administration that would give states more freedom to impose co-payments and premiums for certain services on Medicaid patients.
docs.snippet: Millions of low-income people could be required to pay more for health care under a proposed federal policy that would give states more freedom to impose additional charges on Medicaid patients.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

docs.lead_paragraph: The recovery effort following Hurricane Sandy has been uneven, and there is ample evidence that many people are still struggling in the aftermath of one of the most vicious storms to hit the region.

headline.seo: Recovery Remains Spotty 3 Months After Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Recovery Remains Spotty 3 Months After Hurricane
headline.print_headline: Recovery Remains Spotty 3 Months After Hurricane

docs.abstract: Grueling recovery effort following Hurricane Sandy's destruction in New York and New Jersey continues as area residents work to repair, rebuild and reopen shattered homes and businesses;  profiles of how some people and places are faring on the road back highlighted.
docs.snippet: The recovery effort following Hurricane Sandy has been uneven, and there is ample evidence that many people are still struggling in the aftermath of one of the most vicious storms to hit the region.

docs.lead_paragraph: In Springfield, Ill., the state capital where President Obama served as a legislator, residents looked to his second term with a mixture of anxiety, uncertainty and a muted hopefulness.

headline.seo: In Springfield, Ill., Applause for Obama Is Muted
headline.main: Applause Is Muted in City With Role in President’s Rise
headline.print_headline: Applause Is Muted in City With Role in President’s Rise

docs.abstract: Residents of Springfield, Ill, state capital where Pres Obama served as a legislator, watch inauguration and look to his second term with mixture of anxiety, uncertainty and muted hopefulness.
docs.snippet: In Springfield, Ill., the state capital where President Obama served as a legislator, residents looked to his second term with a mixture of anxiety, uncertainty and a muted hopefulness.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s second inaugural address indicated a leader less willing to start negotiations by moving to the center.

headline.seo: Obama’s Speech Is Urgent Call for Progressive Values
headline.main: Speech Reveals an Evolved and Unapologetic President
headline.print_headline: A Call for Progressive Values: Evolved, Unapologetic and Urgent

docs.abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama's second inaugural address indicates a leader less willing to start negotiations by moving to the center and less bound by electoral fears.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s second inaugural address indicated a leader less willing to start negotiations by moving to the center.
